{"id":1069798352,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"1 month, 1 week","timestamp":1696734517,"status":11,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/1069798352/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Apply Operations to Make Two Strings Equal","memory":"N/A","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    int minOperations(string s1, string s2, int x) {\n        int a=0,b=0;\n        for(int i=0;i<s1.length();i++){\n            if(s1[i]=='1')a++;\n        }\n        for(int i=0;i<s2.length();i++){\n            if(s2[i]=='1')b++;\n        }\n        if(a!=b)return -1;\n int n = s1.length();\n    int cost = 0;\n\n    for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {\n        if (s1[i] != s2[i]) {\n            if (i + 1 < n && s1[i + 1] != s1[i] && s2[i + 1] != s2[i]) {\n                // Option 1: Flip s1[i] and s1[i+1] together.\n                cost += x;\n                s1[i] = s2[i];\n                s1[i + 1] = s2[i + 1];\n            } else {\n                // Option 2: Flip s1[i] alone.\n                cost += 1;\n                s1[i] = s2[i];\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    if (s1 == s2) {\n        return cost;\n    } else {\n        return -1; // It's impossible to make them equal.\n    }\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"apply-operations-to-make-two-strings-equal","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
